This is an excellent idea. To those putting a downer on it, standing idly by and not doing something is far worse than not having a successful attempt at something.

This is a great idea, initiative and while it won't solve all the problems, it's a step in the right direction.

You can't fix everything with one simple change, it takes a lot of little steps and persistence.
This won't work. {{sticker:sg-ahri-3}}

Yet toxicity runs rampant.... bit hypocritical when reports are disregarded, yes? If you have a mental health issue you know how damaging bming and unsportsmanlike conduct can be, yet riot even in their tips and hints says bming is fine.... and then they act as though they care about mental health by doing this.

To all the haters flaming this because of the amazing toxicity that is already within the games community - Change does'nt just happen. This is an initative, not the answer. Change starts from us. If you feel that this will have no impact, THEN THIS IS FOR YOU! Mental health isnt a subject to brush off, nor is this a point to feel that Riot are in there for the publicity. 

Riot are well aware of the issues that plague the title both within and outside the game (looking at you reddit) but to rule with an Iron Fist on anyone that says anything negative is counter productive. On the vice versa, doing nothing (like not punishing toxic players, or people that give up) also results in nothing. 

Having a network that promotes healthy life choices, especially for your mental state, is the right direction to promote a healthy community. Dont flame the Yas that is feeding mid, maybe be positive and give some helpful tips... yes you will lose LP, and it SUCKS!!!! But Flaming will only tilt more, it doesn't fix the problem. No-one will get better if all they hear is that they are trash, and you wont get better if you keep vsing players that are not skilled (sure you will stomp, but then when you rank up you will get stomped). 

I support this and would love for the community to look into this as well. If you want change, be the change.. not the flame!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
